Utterances: Hello, my name is Macie. I'll be your nurse today.
Hi.
Can you tell me your name and date of birth?
Regina Walker, I was born January 1st . . . [Ms. Walker reports correct birth year.]
Can you tell me where you are?
I'm in the hospital.
Can you tell me why you are here?
I was having trouble with the pain from my cancer... I just couldn't take it anymore at home.
I'm sorry to hear that.
Thank you for saying that. Really.
Can you tell me what year it is?
It's . . . [Ms. Walker reports the correct year.]
Are you currently taking any medications?
I take two types of morphine at home every day and I also manage my hypertension with Hyzaar.
When was the last time you took this medication? (Clarified to When was the last time you took any medications?.)
I took some of the fast-acting morphine this morning, but it wasn't much help. Pain just cut right through it. I haven't yet had my Hyzaar. (Clarified to when I last took medication.)
I am sorry to hear that the pain medication isnt working.
I appreciate the sympathy.
On a scale of 0-10 how would you rate your pain with 10 being the worst imaginable pain and 0 being no pain? (Clarified to Can you rate your current pain level on a scale of 0 to 10?.)
Right now, I'm about a 4 of 10. (Clarified to how I would rate my pain on a scale.)
You said you havent taken your hypertension medication this morning? (No matching questions found.)
You havent taken your hypertension medication this morning? (No matching questions found.)
You havent taken your hypertension medication, correct? (No matching questions found.)
You havent taken your hypertension medication? (No matching questions found.)
Where is your pain located?
Well, everywhere really . . . These past days I've felt it mostly in my ribs and legs but even my bones hurt.
Would you describe this pain as stabbing, aching, or throbbing pain? (Clarified to Would you describe the pain as aching?.)
No, the pain doesn't feel like that. (Clarified to if the pain is aching.)
throbbing? (No matching questions found.)
Would you define it as throbbing? (No matching questions found.)
Is it a throbbing pain? (No matching questions found.)
Is it a stabbing pain?
No, the pain doesn't feel like that.
Can you describe the pain for me?
I can feel it all over my body . . . It's a sharp pain in my bones, my legs, and my ribs. It's been getting much worse over the past two days.
Is there anything that aggravates the pain?
Nothing makes the pain worse, nothing makes it better. It's just constant and relentless.
I am sorry that you are in so much pain.
Thank you. Your kindness is felt.
Do you have any allergies that you are aware of?
Well, I don't have allergies to anything but penicillin. I told them right when I arrived.
I had that in the chart I just wanted to clarify with you.
I appreciate the information.
What happens when you take penicillin?
I'm fairly certain I just got a rash when I found out I was allergic.
Okay. I am going to ask you more about your home medications.
Thanks. Perhaps that could help me.
You take long-acting morphine, do you remember the dosage? (Clarified to How are you taking the long acting morphine?.)
My morphine all comes in pill form, both the fast and slow acting. (Clarified to what form the long acting morphine is.)
How often do you take it?
Usually I take the long-acting morphine every 12 hours, and the immediate release whenever the pain gets to be too much.
Do you take any over the counter medications?
All of my medications are prescription.
Do you take any herbal supplements?
No, I've never thought much of those.
Do you use any substances?
No, I do not.
Do you drink?
No, I haven't had alcohol for a few years.

Do you have any difficulty breathing?
No, I don't have any breathing difficulties.
Do you have any chest pain?
No, my pain there is more in the lower rib area.
Auscultated bowel sounds
When was your last bowel movement?
It's actually been four days since I last went... I've tried a few times but even if I strain nothing works.
Do you take any laxative for that?
I don't use laxatives, no. I suppose I could, what with my constipation the past four days.
I will communicate with your doctor and see if we could start you on something to help with that.
You're kind for filling me in.
What is a normal meal for you?
I don't eat anything too heavy or unhealthy. Toast, crackers, yogurt, peanut butter. That sort of light fare, and only a few bites of it before I'm full.
Including some fiber in your diet can help with constipation.
Thanks. Perhaps that could help me.

Apple, penny, and table.

Have you felt depressed over the past 2 weeks?
I have my ups and downs. Nothing so down I'd call depression, though.
Can you describe your living environment?

I'm living with my husband in our home. I'm happy there still, all the familiar surroundings, visits from our friends . . . but if the pain is going to be as bad as this morning from now on, I'm not sure what I can do about it at home.
Do you feel safe at home?
Of course, I've never felt threatened at home.
Are you able to do activities of daily living such as bath, dress, and toileting?
Well, some things I'm able to do still, but my husband has to help me with quite a bit these days. I spend most of my time in bed.
Are you able to bath yourself?
I don't bathe on my own anymore. My husband helps me, especially with getting in and out of the shower, and we have a shower bench that I sit on.
Are you able to dress yourself?
I don't have any trouble dressing myself.
Are you able to use the restroom by yourself?
No, I'll usually need a hand with that.
Are you able to transfer around the house by yourself? (Clarified to Can you transfer by yourself?.)

Well, I have the most trouble getting up from any sort of lying position, so I spend most of my time in bed. My husband usually gives me a hand when I need to get up. (Clarified to if I am able to transfer myself.)
Do you have any issues with continence?
I'm still in control of my bladder and bowels, thankfully.
Are you able eat independently?
Yes, I haven't gotten to that point yet and hopefully won't have to ever worry about having someone feed me.
How are your sleeping habits?
I'll take my medication before bed generally and just try to get what sleep I can. My quality of sleep has been quite poor lately though.
How many hours of sleep would you say that you are getting? (No matching questions found.)
How many hours of sleep are you getting?
It's hard to say, maybe a few hours a night?
Have you been confused at all recently?
No, I'm not confused right now. This morning the pain was making it a bit hard to think but I'm all here now.
Have you had any falls?
No, I haven't had any recent falls.
Have you had any weight changes?
Yes, I've lost 20 pounds or so in the past two months.
Has your health had any effects on social activity?
Yes, it certainly does. I love that we get plenty of visitors at our house, but it's hard for me even to get up and see them sometimes.
What is your perception of health?
I'd say my health is poor in general. I'm quite aware of the situation I'm in.
How has your energy levels been lately?
I've been feeling weak most of the time for the past few months.
Have you had any recent ER visits or hospitalizations? (Clarified to Have you had any ER visits or hospitalizations?.)

I've been through surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation treatment time and time again for the past few years. My last treatment stopped around three months ago after they told me there was nothing else they could do. . . (Clarified to if I have had any ER visits or hospitalizations.)
Im sorry to hear that. It sounds like youve been through a lot recently.
I appreciate the good will.
What kind of surgeries have you had?
I had a mastectomy about 5 years ago for the cancer, and before that a hernia repair surgery.
Do you have any other health issues?
The only condition I'm very concerned about right now is my cancer.
Do you have advanced directives?
Yes, all my affairs should be in order.
What are your preferences for hospice?

I want to allow things to take their course . . . it's time for me to stop fighting and just enjoy the time I have left in what little ways I can. My husband and I have chosen an assisted living residence near my home where I'll go for hospice care. I have been told that they can help me with the pain there .  . . and it's close enough that my husband can be with me.
When was your most recent meal?
Let's see, I had a few bites of yogurt last night before bed... I think that was the last time I had anything.
Assessed vitals
what would you rate you pain?
Right now, I'm about a 4 of 10.
When were you diagnosed with cancer?
I was diagnosed with breast cancer five years ago. It's now stage IV, and has spread to my liver and bones.
Does you family have any medication issues? (Clarified to Do your family members have health problems?.)

My parents both have passed on, but they had a few health issues while they were still with us. Both had high blood pressure and cholesterol and my father had type 2 diabetes as well. (Clarified to if my family members have health problems.)
I'm sorry to hear that they have both passed away.
Yes, thanks very much.
Do you have any social history?

Raymond and I have a nice group of families from the church who we see pretty regularly. They've really been great to us and have lifted quite a lot of weight from our shoulders. It's been difficult to see them with my pain as of late though . . .
Does anyone take advantage of you?

No, no one in my family would ever steal from me . . . they would never do that. My husband is the one responsible for my . . . for my will, and our finances. I trust him unconditionally to take care of those matters.
I am preparing a care plan for you. My nursing diagnosis is for you to exhibit readiness for effective coping.
I understand what you're saying. Thank you.
My short term goal is that you will be able to verbalize understanding of coping methods, available resources, and understanding of hospice care.
I consent. You can begin now.
